intro: Bonamia corumbaensis, commonly known as the Corumba morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its trumpet-shaped, violet-blue flowers. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
